trans-unit.source: Runbook Output and Messages in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Runbook Output and Messages in Azure Automation | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Desribes how to create and retrieve output and error messages from runbooks in Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: Desribes how to create and retrieve output and error messages from runbooks in Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: Runbook output and messages in Azure Automation
trans-unit.target: Runbook output and messages in Azure Automation

trans-unit.source: Most Azure Automation runbooks will have some form of output such as an error message to the user or a complex object intended to be consumed by another workflow.
trans-unit.target: Most Azure Automation runbooks will have some form of output such as an error message to the user or a complex object intended to be consumed by another workflow.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell provides [multiple streams](http://blogs.technet.com/heyscriptingguy/archive/2014/03/30/understanding-streams-redirection-and-write-host-in-powershell.aspx) to send output from a script or workflow.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell provides [multiple streams](http://blogs.technet.com/heyscriptingguy/archive/2014/03/30/understanding-streams-redirection-and-write-host-in-powershell.aspx) to send output from a script or workflow.

trans-unit.source: Azure Automation works with each of these streams differently, and you should follow best practices for how to use each when you are creating a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Azure Automation works with each of these streams differently, and you should follow best practices for how to use each when you are creating a runbook.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides a brief description of each of the streams and their behavior in the Azure Management Portal both when running a published runbook and when [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The following table provides a brief description of each of the streams and their behavior in the Azure Management Portal both when running a published runbook and when [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Further details on each stream are provided in subsequent sections.
trans-unit.target: Further details on each stream are provided in subsequent sections.

trans-unit.source: Stream
trans-unit.target: Stream

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Published
trans-unit.target: Published

trans-unit.source: Test
trans-unit.target: Test

trans-unit.source: Output
trans-unit.target: Output

trans-unit.source: Objects intended to be consumed by other runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Objects intended to be consumed by other runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Written to the job history.
trans-unit.target: Written to the job history.

trans-unit.source: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Warning
trans-unit.target: Warning

trans-unit.source: Warning message intended for the user.
trans-unit.target: Warning message intended for the user.

trans-unit.source: Written to the job history.
trans-unit.target: Written to the job history.

trans-unit.source: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Error
trans-unit.target: Error

trans-unit.source: Error message intended for the user.
trans-unit.target: Error message intended for the user.

trans-unit.source: Unlike an exception, the runbook continues after an error message by default.
trans-unit.target: Unlike an exception, the runbook continues after an error message by default.

trans-unit.source: Written to the job history.
trans-unit.target: Written to the job history.

trans-unit.source: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Displayed in the Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Verbose
trans-unit.target: Verbose

trans-unit.source: Messages providing general or debugging information.
trans-unit.target: Messages providing general or debugging information.

trans-unit.source: Written to job history only if verbose logging is turned on for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Written to job history only if verbose logging is turned on for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Displayed in the Test Output pane only if $VerbosePreference is set to Continue in the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Displayed in the Test Output pane only if $VerbosePreference is set to Continue in the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Progress
trans-unit.target: Progress

trans-unit.source: Records automatically generated before and after each activity in the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Records automatically generated before and after each activity in the runbook.

trans-unit.source: The runbook should not attempt to create its own progress records since they are intended for an interactive user.
trans-unit.target: The runbook should not attempt to create its own progress records since they are intended for an interactive user.

trans-unit.source: Written to job history only if progress logging is turned on for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Written to job history only if progress logging is turned on for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Not displayed in the Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Not displayed in the Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Debug
trans-unit.target: Debug

trans-unit.source: Messages intended for an interactive user.
trans-unit.target: Messages intended for an interactive user.

trans-unit.source: Should not be used in runbooks.
trans-unit.target: Should not be used in runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Not written to job history.
trans-unit.target: Not written to job history.

trans-unit.source: Not written to Test Output Pane.
trans-unit.target: Not written to Test Output Pane.

trans-unit.source: Output stream
trans-unit.target: Output stream

trans-unit.source: The Output stream is intended for output of objects created by a script or workflow when it runs correctly.
trans-unit.target: The Output stream is intended for output of objects created by a script or workflow when it runs correctly.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Automation, this stream is primarily used for objects intended to be consumed by [parent runbooks that call the current runbook](automation-child-runbooks.md).
trans-unit.target: In Azure Automation, this stream is primarily used for objects intended to be consumed by [parent runbooks that call the current runbook](automation-child-runbooks.md).

trans-unit.source: When you [call a runbook inline](automation-child-runbooks.md/#InlineExecution) from a parent runbook, it returns data from the output stream to the parent.
trans-unit.target: When you [call a runbook inline](automation-child-runbooks.md/#InlineExecution) from a parent runbook, it returns data from the output stream to the parent.

trans-unit.source: You should only use the output stream to communicate general information back to the user if you know the runbook will never be called by another runbook.
trans-unit.target: You should only use the output stream to communicate general information back to the user if you know the runbook will never be called by another runbook.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, however, you should typically use the [Verbose Stream](#Verbose) to communicate general information to the user.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, however, you should typically use the [Verbose Stream](#Verbose) to communicate general information to the user.

trans-unit.source: You can write data to the output stream using [Write-Output](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849921.aspx) or by putting the object on its own line in the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can write data to the output stream using [Write-Output](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849921.aspx) or by putting the object on its own line in the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Output from a function
trans-unit.target: Output from a function

trans-unit.source: When you write to the output stream in a function that is included in your runbook, the output is passed back to the runbook.
trans-unit.target: When you write to the output stream in a function that is included in your runbook, the output is passed back to the runbook.

trans-unit.source: If the runbook assigns that output to a variable, then it is not written to the output stream.
trans-unit.target: If the runbook assigns that output to a variable, then it is not written to the output stream.

trans-unit.source: Writing to any other streams from within the function will write to the corresponding stream for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Writing to any other streams from within the function will write to the corresponding stream for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Consider the following sample runbook.
trans-unit.target: Consider the following sample runbook.

trans-unit.source: The output stream for the runbook job would be:
trans-unit.target: The output stream for the runbook job would be:

trans-unit.source: The verbose stream for the runbook job would be:
trans-unit.target: The verbose stream for the runbook job would be:

trans-unit.source: Declaring output data type
trans-unit.target: Declaring output data type

trans-unit.source: A workflow can specify the data type of its output using the [OutputType attribute](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847785.aspx).
trans-unit.target: A workflow can specify the data type of its output using the [OutputType attribute](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847785.aspx).

trans-unit.source: This attribute has no effect during runtime, but it provides an indication to the runbook author at design time of the expected output of the runbook.
trans-unit.target: This attribute has no effect during runtime, but it provides an indication to the runbook author at design time of the expected output of the runbook.

trans-unit.source: As the toolset for runbooks continues to evolve, the importance of declaring output data types at design time will increase in importance.
trans-unit.target: As the toolset for runbooks continues to evolve, the importance of declaring output data types at design time will increase in importance.

trans-unit.source: As a result, it is a best practice to include this declaration in any runbooks that you create.
trans-unit.target: As a result, it is a best practice to include this declaration in any runbooks that you create.

trans-unit.source: The following sample runbook outputs a string object and includes a declaration of its output type.
trans-unit.target: The following sample runbook outputs a string object and includes a declaration of its output type.

trans-unit.source: If your runbook outputs an array of a certain type, then you should still specify the type as opposed to an array of the type.
trans-unit.target: If your runbook outputs an array of a certain type, then you should still specify the type as opposed to an array of the type.

trans-unit.source: Message streams
trans-unit.target: Message streams

trans-unit.source: Unlike the output stream, message streams are intended to communicate information to the user.
trans-unit.target: Unlike the output stream, message streams are intended to communicate information to the user.

trans-unit.source: There are multiple message streams for different kinds of information, and each is handled differently by Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: There are multiple message streams for different kinds of information, and each is handled differently by Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: Warning and error streams
trans-unit.target: Warning and error streams

trans-unit.source: The Warning and Error streams are intended to log problems that occur in a runbook.
trans-unit.target: The Warning and Error streams are intended to log problems that occur in a runbook.

trans-unit.source: They are written to the job history when a runbook is executed, and are included in the Test Output Pane in the Azure Management Portal when a runbook is tested.
trans-unit.target: They are written to the job history when a runbook is executed, and are included in the Test Output Pane in the Azure Management Portal when a runbook is tested.

trans-unit.source: By default, the runbook will continue executing after a warning or error.
trans-unit.target: By default, the runbook will continue executing after a warning or error.

trans-unit.source: You can specify that the runbook should be suspended on a warning or error by setting a [preference variable](#PreferenceVariables) in the runbook before creating the message.
trans-unit.target: You can specify that the runbook should be suspended on a warning or error by setting a [preference variable](#PreferenceVariables) in the runbook before creating the message.

trans-unit.source: For example, to cause a runbook to suspend on an error as it would an exception, set **$ErrorActionPreference** to Stop.
trans-unit.target: For example, to cause a runbook to suspend on an error as it would an exception, set **$ErrorActionPreference** to Stop.

trans-unit.source: Create a warning or error message using the [Write-Warning](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849931.aspx) or [Write-Error](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849962.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create a warning or error message using the [Write-Warning](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849931.aspx) or [Write-Error](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849962.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Activities may also write to these streams.
trans-unit.target: Activities may also write to these streams.

trans-unit.source: Verbose stream
trans-unit.target: Verbose stream

trans-unit.source: The Verbose message stream is for general information about the runbook operation.
trans-unit.target: The Verbose message stream is for general information about the runbook operation.

trans-unit.source: Since the [Debug Stream](#Debug) is not available in a runbook, verbose messages should be used for debug information.
trans-unit.target: Since the [Debug Stream](#Debug) is not available in a runbook, verbose messages should be used for debug information.

trans-unit.source: By default, verbose messages from published runbooks will not be stored in the job history.
trans-unit.target: By default, verbose messages from published runbooks will not be stored in the job history.

trans-unit.source: To store verbose messages, configure published runbooks to Log Verbose Records on the Configure tab of the runbook in the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: To store verbose messages, configure published runbooks to Log Verbose Records on the Configure tab of the runbook in the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, you should keep the default setting of not logging verbose records for a runbook for performance reasons.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, you should keep the default setting of not logging verbose records for a runbook for performance reasons.

trans-unit.source: Turn on this option only to troubleshoot or debug a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Turn on this option only to troubleshoot or debug a runbook.

trans-unit.source: When [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx), verbose messages are not displayed even if the runbook is configured to log verbose records.
trans-unit.target: When [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx), verbose messages are not displayed even if the runbook is configured to log verbose records.

trans-unit.source: To display verbose messages while [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx), you must set the $VerbosePreference variable to Continue.
trans-unit.target: To display verbose messages while [testing a runbook](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn879147.aspx), you must set the $VerbosePreference variable to Continue.

trans-unit.source: With that variable set, verbose messages will be displayed in the Test Output Pane of the Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: With that variable set, verbose messages will be displayed in the Test Output Pane of the Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Create a verbose message using the [Write-Verbose](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849951.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Create a verbose message using the [Write-Verbose](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849951.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Debug stream
trans-unit.target: Debug stream

trans-unit.source: The Debug stream is intended for use with an interactive user and should not be used in runbooks.
trans-unit.target: The Debug stream is intended for use with an interactive user and should not be used in runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Progress records
trans-unit.target: Progress records

trans-unit.source: If you configure a runbook to log progress records (on the Configure tab of the runbook in the Azure Management Portal), then a record will be written to the job history before and after each activity is run.
trans-unit.target: If you configure a runbook to log progress records (on the Configure tab of the runbook in the Azure Management Portal), then a record will be written to the job history before and after each activity is run.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, you should keep the default setting of not logging progress records for a runbook in order to maximize performance.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, you should keep the default setting of not logging progress records for a runbook in order to maximize performance.

trans-unit.source: Turn on this option only to troubleshoot or debug a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Turn on this option only to troubleshoot or debug a runbook.

trans-unit.source: When testing a runbook, progress messages are not displayed even if the runbook is configured to log progress records.
trans-unit.target: When testing a runbook, progress messages are not displayed even if the runbook is configured to log progress records.

trans-unit.source: The [Write-Progress](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849902.aspx) cmdlet is not valid in a runbook, since this is intended for use with an interactive user.
trans-unit.target: The [Write-Progress](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh849902.aspx) cmdlet is not valid in a runbook, since this is intended for use with an interactive user.

trans-unit.source: Preference variables
trans-unit.target: Preference variables

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell uses [preference variables](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847796.aspx) to determine how to respond to data sent to different output streams.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell uses [preference variables](http://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847796.aspx) to determine how to respond to data sent to different output streams.

trans-unit.source: You can set these variables in a runbook to control how it will respond to data sent into different streams.
trans-unit.target: You can set these variables in a runbook to control how it will respond to data sent into different streams.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the preference variables that can be used in runbooks with their valid and default values.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the preference variables that can be used in runbooks with their valid and default values.

trans-unit.source: Note that this table only includes the values that are valid in a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Note that this table only includes the values that are valid in a runbook.

trans-unit.source: Additional values are valid for the preference variables when used in Windows PowerShell outside of Azure Automation.
trans-unit.target: Additional values are valid for the preference variables when used in Windows PowerShell outside of Azure Automation.

trans-unit.source: Variable
trans-unit.target: Variable

trans-unit.source: Default Value
trans-unit.target: Default Value

trans-unit.source: Valid Values
trans-unit.target: Valid Values

trans-unit.target: WarningPreference

trans-unit.target: SilentlyContinue

trans-unit.target: Stop

trans-unit.target: SilentlyContinue

trans-unit.source: VerbosePreference
trans-unit.target: VerbosePreference

trans-unit.source: SilentlyContinue
trans-unit.target: SilentlyContinue

trans-unit.target: Stop

trans-unit.source: SilentlyContinue
trans-unit.target: SilentlyContinue

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the behavior for the preference variable values that are valid in runbooks.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the behavior for the preference variable values that are valid in runbooks.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Behavior
trans-unit.target: Behavior

trans-unit.source: Continue
trans-unit.target: Continue

trans-unit.source: Logs the message and continues executing the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Logs the message and continues executing the runbook.

trans-unit.source: SilentlyContinue
trans-unit.target: SilentlyContinue

trans-unit.source: Continues executing the runbook without logging the message.
trans-unit.target: Continues executing the runbook without logging the message.

trans-unit.source: This has the effect of ignoring the message.
trans-unit.target: This has the effect of ignoring the message.

trans-unit.source: Stop
trans-unit.target: Stop

trans-unit.source: Logs the message and suspends the runbook.
trans-unit.target: Logs the message and suspends the runbook.

trans-unit.source: Retrieving runbook output and messages
trans-unit.target: Retrieving runbook output and messages

trans-unit.source: Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: Azure management portal

trans-unit.source: You can view the details of a runbook job in the Azure Management Portal from the Jobs tab of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can view the details of a runbook job in the Azure Management Portal from the Jobs tab of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: The Summary of the job will display the input parameters and the [Output Stream](#Output) in addition to general information about the job and any exceptions if they occurred.
trans-unit.target: The Summary of the job will display the input parameters and the [Output Stream](#Output) in addition to general information about the job and any exceptions if they occurred.

trans-unit.source: The History will include messages from the [Output Stream](#Output) and [Warning and Error Streams](#WarningError) in addition to the [Verbose Stream](#Verbose) and [Progress Records](#Progress) if the runbook is configured to log verbose and progress records.
trans-unit.target: The History will include messages from the [Output Stream](#Output) and [Warning and Error Streams](#WarningError) in addition to the [Verbose Stream](#Verbose) and [Progress Records](#Progress) if the runbook is configured to log verbose and progress records.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: In Windows PowerShell, you can retrieve output and messages from a runbook using the [Get-AzureAutomationJobOutput](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn690268.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: In Windows PowerShell, you can retrieve output and messages from a runbook using the [Get-AzureAutomationJobOutput](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn690268.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: This cmdlet requires the ID of the job and has a parameter called Stream where you specify which stream to return.
trans-unit.target: This cmdlet requires the ID of the job and has a parameter called Stream where you specify which stream to return.

trans-unit.source: You can specify Any to return all streams for the job.
trans-unit.target: You can specify Any to return all streams for the job.

trans-unit.source: The following example starts a sample runbook and then waits for it to complete.
trans-unit.target: The following example starts a sample runbook and then waits for it to complete.

trans-unit.source: Once completed, its output stream is collected from the job.
trans-unit.target: Once completed, its output stream is collected from the job.
